intro: Aloe marlothii, commonly known as the Cape aloe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with red or purple margins. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with small, tubular flowers that are usually yellow or orange. Aloe marlothii is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive drought conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
